page.title: 08EVENTS.
page.content: During the first week in September Fladbury holds it's annual walk-about. This fund raising event realized Â£5,000 in 1985 for the Church Tower restoration fund. All the main buildings in the village are open to the public.The Church contains a Flower Festival with a different theme each year. The Water Mill is open to visitors as are many of the beautiful gardens which extend to the river.The school houses the village Folk Museum and the Childrens' Art and Craft Exhibition. There are also demonstrations by various craftsmen. Morris Dancing,veteran cars, shirehorses and boat trips down the River Avon are other features of this weekend.
